author: cbs8
title: Frances McHenrys New Book I Can Only Imagine Dad is a Prolific Work of Fiction that Explores the Ideas of Truth and Personal Identity
text:
Recent release “I Can Only Imagine Dad” from Page Publishing author Frances McHenry is a philosophical, creative, in-depth work that delves into one’s family dynamics and self-exploration.
(PRWEB) October 16, 2015
Frances McHenry, a retired educator, avid reader, cook, traveler, decorator, creative writer and author, has completed her newest work “I Can Only Imagine Dad”: a passionately crafted work that portrays the desire for acceptance and self-worth.
“There is a warm, homespun quality to ‘I Can Only Imagine Dad’ that begins with the book's charming book cover. The author's idea is a clever one and her talent for writing is evident. The story is quite captivating and heartwarming. The characters are fully drawn and intriguing. McHenry has a talent for storytelling. It would be interesting should she choose to write another book because the potential is there. Her style is reminiscent of Dorothy Garlock, who is well known for homespun period romances,” said reader and critic Valerie Porter.
Published by New York City-based Page Publishing, Frances McHenry’s poignant tale details the main character’s and author’s creative way of overcoming her own insecurities through story telling. “I Can Only Imagine Dad” shares Frances McHenry's story of how she came into existence-whether real or imaginary. The story steps through real events of time like World War I and World War II, as she imagines them. As a new author, Mrs. McHenry has imagined and woven together a very vivid account of what may have been the story of how her two biological parents came together.
As a young girl, Frances yearned so badly for the love of a father. She would imagine herself walking around like the young bird in P.D. Eastman's book, "Are You My Mother?" A seasoned storyteller in her book "I Can Only Imagine Dad", Frances is symbolically searching and asking everyone she comes into contact with the lifelong question that she is still asking today - Are You My Father? Readers who wish to experience this inspiring work can purchase “I Can Only Imagine Dad” at bookstores everywhere or online at the Apple iTunes store, Amazon, Google Play or Barnes and Noble.
For additional information or media inquiries, contact Page Publishing at 866-315-2708.
About Page Publishing
Page Publishing is a traditional New York based full-service publishing house that handles all of the intricacies involved in publishing its authors’ books, including distribution in the world’s largest retail outlets and royalty generation. Page Publishing knows that authors need to be free to create - not bogged down with complicated business issues like eBook conversion, establishing wholesale accounts, insurance, shipping, taxes and the like. Its roster of authors can leave behind these tedious, complex and time consuming issues, and focus on their passion: writing and creating. Learn more at http://www.pagepublishing.com .
